page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY: Walshaw Hall
page.content: There has been a house on the site since early 18th Century, but the present hall was built in 1853.It was a family home until 1946 when it was taken over by the Freemasons and made it into an old peoples' home.In 1978 the MacPherson group took over for conferences and functions.They had to repair the roof, walls and floor. The Finnish government have taken over MacPhersons but the hall will still be used for conferences.Each room for hire has a different price depending on size and time of year. There are some foreign plants which arrived when seeds got stuck to cotton used in local mills.Some are so rare they are not allowed to be shown.Other plants include bamboo, chinese witch hazel and a monkey puzzle tree.The wildlife includes badgers, rabbits owls and woodpeckers.
